pros: I loved my time at Little Friends. The people care for the residents and that is what matters most.
cons: It can be physical work

pros: The coworkers are a great bunch.
cons: There is not enough staff in the classrooms to teach children with special needs, much less manage behavior.

job_title: Graphic Artist in Downers Grove, IL
pros: The workload is constant and you will always find something to do. Everyone is friendly and helpful. Teams collaborate and flow well, freely giving creative input. Management assists their teams well and fosters an efficient workflow.
cons: Sometimes projects are thrown in and it leaves little room for learning or recognizing mistakes.

pros: The training program at LF is unmatched within the industry. Even if you’d consider yourself an expert, I’d bet money that you’ll learn something during their training program that will completely change the way you approach your job and the work you’re devoting your life to every day.
cons: None that I can remember. I left the company on good terms.

pros: Benefits were good. I loved the clients. I enjoyed my coworkers. I had a good relationship with coworkers.
cons: The company use to be great. My son was diagnosed here years ago when he was 5. The place has gone down hill and fast. It is unfortunate. The company does not care about employees but rather, how much money can be made. In this industry I get it is a business and has to make money, but for that to be the only focus for the most part is wrong. The CEO is a business person and it is evident in all aspects. It is a shame really.

pros: Little Friends is an all-around great company. I love working here and have since the very first day I was hired on. If you’re thinking of working here, all I can say is that you’d be a fool not to.
cons: There is absolutely no downside to working here.

pros: Not only was this an extremely rewarding job, but it was also a wonderful learning experience. Each day presented me with new challenges. There is definitely far more to being a developmental trainer than what meets the eye, and I was pleased to find that I was beyond capable of helping individuals in need in a significant way.
cons: The earnings potential in this field just isn’t that great, which is a shame considering how much work goes into it.

pros: -Coworkers come together to help each other out. -Managers are friendly and they make a point of keeping themselves in the loop. -The atmosphere is super positive.
cons: Nothing. I honestly think that leadership does an exceptional job of running LF with integrity, and whenever they make changes, they do so with our best interests at heart, as well as students’.

pros: The kids were adorable! I loved getting to know them and their families, and their little smiles when they saw me were sooo stinkin’ cute.
cons: The reality is that this job isn’t for everyone. If you aren’t passionate about working with kids, then do yourself and THEM a favor and work somewhere else.

pros: Good people running things Competitive pay Full benefits Friendly work environment Plenty of support Strong, community-minded mission Purposeful tasks and projects
cons: I left because my wife and I moved out of state.

pros: Friendly coworkers, an overwhelming sense of fulfillment and purpose, a positive impact, and paid well for it
cons: Nothing that I’ve noticed so far

pros: I’m not normally the type to write reviews, but Little Friends deserves one. They have exceeded every single one of my expectations.
cons: I don’t have any complaints whatsoever.

pros: Amazing people to work with, positive company culture
cons: Communication isn’t the best. I know that I’m part of the problem too and I’m actively working on fixing that.

job_title: Speech Language Pathologist in Naperville, IL
pros: Little Friends will always have a place is my heart as my second home. Working here was one of the most memorable experiences of my life.
cons: Unfortunately, my commute would’ve been too long after I relocated, so I had to resign.

pros: Some of the best people in the business.
cons: Nothing in particular comes to mind.

pros: Supportive, energetic environment. Employees have a great deal of autonomy. Training and supervision is excellent. Staff are encouraged to think outside the box. Promotion from within is encouraged and happens often. The services provided to families and individuals with intellectual disabilities is above and beyond expectation. All around a great place to work.
cons: Working in this field is challenging. Lack of funding continues to negatively impact the population served.

job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Naperville, IL
pros: Little Friends is committed to promoting from within. The agency has terrific benefits. It is a great place to build a career. There are numerous opportunities for growth. Training is strong.
cons: Pay is low. The company is striving to find its place and direction.

pros: I really appreciated working for a company where the staff were supportive and flexible. Everyone contributed when they could and always provided ample support + information and I was always given enough time to accomplish my duties.
cons: The hours worked were not always predictable. A simple day could become very complicated very quickly.

pros: I’ve felt welcomed and supported since day 1.
cons: It’s a tad hectic at times.

pros: It is rewarding to help children and families that are most at risk. It is a great place to work with a strong mission, vision and commitment to clients.
cons: At times, we need more staff to provide high quality early care and education to the children.

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Naperville, IL
pros: I honestly enjoyed working for Little Friends and would like to go back someday if possible. Working there was a happy 2-ish years for me and I really felt like I gained a lot of valuable experience. I left for personal reasons and I hope to be back in the future.
cons: The hours are a little sparse. I always wanted a bit more.

job_title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) in Naperville, IL
pros: This is a top-notch organization.
cons: Only the usual difficulties that come with the territory.

pros: The team I worked with were incredibly supportive. The expansion of programs has been beneficial to the organization and the communities they serve.
cons: The work expectation sometimes seems unrealistic. The ability to balance work and life can be difficult sometimes.

pros: I have worked at LF almost 3 years. The benefits are excellent. Generous vacation time and strong health benefits. Committed co-workers who want to make the world a better place.
cons: Long hours. Many changes being made.

pros: The company is growing and always improving. Management does well to take staff concerns to heart and is always there to be helpful.
cons: Some staff can take time to buy into change.

job_title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) in Naperville, IL
pros: The management professionals are kind and compassionate and see their employees as people first with families and other obligations to attend to in addition to work duties.
cons: Since it is a non-profit, the salary is not as good as it would be if you work for a for profit company.

pros: Team environment and support Interested in growth and change for all the right reasons Works hard to determine the needs of employees Open to suggestions and feedback
cons: There were ups and downs, but nothing worth calling out

pros: Positive environment, support from upper management and colleagues, excellent benefit packages available.
cons: Pay could be a little better however the benefits make up for the lower pay.

pros: * Positive place to work * Extremely rewarding * Job never gets boring or monotonous * No matter what position you hold, management NEVER speaks down to you * Treat every employee as a highly valued asset to the company
cons: A non-profit organization and all the struggles that come with that

pros: Good hours, nice coworkers, fulfilling work
cons: We could always use more hands on deck

pros: I feel good about what I do every single day and I enjoy my job. No two days are ever the same and I am never, ever bored.
cons: I cannot really think of any cons for this agency.

pros: Very fair agency. Loved working with the team and families. Stayed with the company until I moved out of state. Treat their families and employees very well!
cons: At times there wasn’t enough work available, however the coordinators tried very hard to satisfy their employees. No other real cons from my experience.

pros: Good environment, children are great!
cons: Salary is low and little room for growth

pros: Great benefits great atmosphere I loved being there
cons: The pay does not reflect the work

pros: Working for a not for profit company that cares so much about their clients.
cons: State funding and cash flow issues.

pros: Being able to help people is rewarding.
cons: Helping people doesn't pay very much.

pros:
Flexible schedule 
Supportive team 
Great benefits and time off 
Generally manageable workload 
Opportunities for growth and community outreach
cons: No room for real advancements

job_title: Developmental Trainer in Downers Grove, IL
pros: Enjoyed my time working here. Staff were nice. Supervisor was very supportive.
cons: The pay was low. May have to deal with some aggressive behaviors. No match for 401k when I was there.

pros:
Good wages 
Flexible hours 
Excellent training 
They really care about their employees and clients
cons: None that I can think of

pros: Good 401k and other benefits.
cons: Lots of screaming and very stressful.

review_title: Good to get your feet wet
pros: Great learning experience if you’re new to case management
cons: Pay was not equivalent to amount of work expected, on call, stress full, responsible to covering shifts if someone calls off

review_title: Pays Chevy rates but demands Cadillac quality
pros:
-Some of the staff are high quality, productive, dedicated and effective
-working with the students and seeing them benefiting from your work
cons:
-Current and recently departed upper management are simply untrustworthy
-The pay is the area's lowest in this sector
-No generosity is displayed toward employees who have stayed through this current under-staffed situation
-Current CEO and other upper management figureheads are content to under-pay staff and have unreasonable expectations for what they should respect
-"You get what you pay for". Being under-paid and held to Eden-like expectations grows old very quickly
-Strong blame-game culture exists at all levels

job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Naperville, IL
pros: The staff is awesome to work with.
cons: Sometimes short staffed and retention is low since covid

pros: Building relationships with students and families, helpful co workers.
cons: Not enough training, short staffed, kids hurting teachers and nothing being done about it

review_title: Get your experience and get out
pros: Fulfilling experience working with students who are on the Autism spectrum in groups and in individual counseling
cons: There seems to be a philosophy that if a student asks for something, despite the fact that they may be actively aggressive or are being disrespectful, you give them what they asked for

pros: Awesome kids, summers off if you want and great HR staff
cons: Always understaffed, under paid. Also, with the new hours it’s hard to find time to talk as a team without having to come in early or stay late.

job_title: Child Care Assistant in Tuscaloosa, AL
pros: The people were very kind
cons: Low pay even for teachers and director

pros: Kids and clients are great.
cons: Hostile Work Conditions High Turnover

pros: great work environment and the clients are enjoyable. Good insurance and friendly coworkers
cons: Management does not care about your mental health. Job can be very stressful and disorganized No work/life balance. Not enough compensation for about of work.

pros: Can't beat the mission of the organization.
cons: Pay is lower than average.

pros: Flexible Easy to get easy to do
cons: Unorganized low pay it’s ok

job_title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst Bcba in Chicago, IL
pros: great clients and a positive work environment
cons: I can't think of any cons

pros:
Solid DSP training experience 
Wonderful clients to work with, help, and be around 
Good HR department
cons:
Extremely unprofessional environment at Admin- upper management engages in extremely inappropriate behavior openly in the office hallways often at the price of deeply offending others 
Hard work is not rewarded monetarily or otherwise- no bonuses, scarce performance reviews, etc. 
No possibility for internal career advancement above the csm/qidp level in CLS
Understaffed, everybody is overworked and attitudes reflect this, job duties expand continuously but pay doesn't 
Extreme lack of competent leadership
No sense of teamwork

pros: It was a great place to grow and learn. They teach you everything that you need to know on the job and provide the training that is necessary to learn. Class sizes are extremely small, so you really get to know the staff that you work with and your students as well. The day is fun, because it is divided up with not just academic work, but also lots of fun like swimming, field trips, singing, and even cooking and computers. I love how small the school is and that the kids have a full curriculum. I learned a lot about autism here. The staff that work here really care about the kids and everyone is really well trained. They have a quiet room specifically for if a child melts down, so you have a space for it to happen without interrupting other students.
cons: You eat lunch with the students. There isn't really much opportunity to get to know other staff in other classrooms. The days are long, you work a full school day during the summer.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Downers Grove, IL
pros: Like most social service jobs, the client interactions and coworkers are the reasons for staying. The pay is one of the best in the area for entry level positions. The staff are friendly, selfless, and work with a focus on the best interest of the clients.
cons: Managers focus on what is easiest for them rather than what is best for their clients. Management rarely confronts employees for unprofessional behavior (being on a cell phone, not staying on top of required paperwork, excessive absences or tardiness).

job_title: Developmental Trainer in Downers Grove, IL
pros: Fully engaged staff that have a invested interest in what they do, which is providing advocacy services for people with intellectual disabilities.  Feeling that you're doing something worthwhile and meaningful in providing a variety of support to the special needs clients.  Comprehensive training program.  This is a position that gives one a deeper insight about life and it's very rewarding experience.  One gets the satisfaction of knowing that they made a difference in the lives of the clients they serve.
cons: Little Friends is a non-profit, so the pay isn't great and raises are scarce--it's just the nature of the "business."  This is a position that can be taxing, but it's rewarding at the same time--one off-sets the other.

pros: Working with the clients is truly rewarding and great experience in the field.  Pay rate is slightly higher than most in the area but no raises will be offered after hiring.
cons: Extremely unprofessional upper management. Changes in leadership roles over the last year have yielded negative results and have caused excessive turnover.  Severely understaffed which leads to burnout quickly.

job_title: Weekend Support Staff in Naperville, IL
pros:
- Availability of hours and opportunity for overtime
- Extensive training
- Ease of communication between staff and management
- Supportive work environment for new hires
- Fostering a sense of community among all employees
cons:
- Placement at other work sites if a need arises during shift
- Use of personal vehicle for transportation at some sites (common in this type of profession though)

job_title: One to One Aide in Naperville, IL
pros: Awesome to work with little kids and help. Fulfilling job.
cons: Terrible pay given for people that work really hard and deal with really terrible things.

pros: I love the students I work with and most of my coworkers are great
cons: The pay is not great. Working in a school provides many challenges to follow ISBE rules, especially in this particular setting.

review_title: It's been a good job but I wouldn't want to stay there long.
pros: Great coworkers! It's a job where you laugh at the crazy things that happen.
cons: Upper management can be rigid. Pay could be better.

job_title: Direct Support Staff in Naperville, IL
pros: flexible hours, paid to sleep, management, professionalism
cons: pay, benefits, no advancement or growth (you make more as a support staff than you do as a case manager, house manager etc.

pros: Working with client's can be very rewarding.
cons: Organization can be difficult since staff constantly switch to different positions or leave.

pros: Teacher's support you, co-workers are friendly, hours are great

pros: Some fun co-workers, some free food, Short work day, paid time off
cons: Pay!!!!  Principal, CEO , COO in it for themselves

pros: Very friendly place and people to work with, and a really good product.
cons: Management changed a bit at the store I worked at.
